definitions.definition: Formally assigned by a government to one of several levels of sensitivity, usually (in English) top secret, secret, confidential, and, in some countries, restricted; thereby making disclosure to unauthorized persons illegal.
definitions.example: We do not discuss specific interrogation techniques because they are classified information.

definitions.definition: Not meant to be disclosed by a person or organization.
To identify by or divide into classes; to categorize
definitions.example: Should we classify "make up" as an idiom or as a phrasal verb?

definitions.definition: To declare something a secret, especially a government secret
definitions.example: They decided to classify that information.

definitions.definition: A classified advertisement in a newspaper or magazine.
definitions.example: He ran a classified for the tools he wanted to sell.
